channel.title: My Old Kentucky Blog
channel.description: a music blog that parties with unicorns

item.title: Video : Elliphant : “Make It Juicy” (ft. Eboi)
item.dc:creator: Gregory Goodin
item.description: Panties, moist, and juicy are the most common words that people have a strong dislike for in any context, except for moist in describing cake. Elliphant’s latest video for “Make it Juicy” does not do anything to help the latter of those three. The black and white video shows lots of liquid spewing [...]
item.content:encoded: Panties, moist, and juicy are the most common words that people have a strong dislike for in any context, except for moist in describing cake. Elliphant’s latest video for “Make it Juicy” does not do anything to help the latter of those three. The black and white video shows lots of liquid spewing out of the mouth and may be NSFW. Proper manners go all out the window on this one. Her self-titled EP is out now via Bigger Splash Records. Watch below.

item.title: Song : Beach Day : “Boys”
item.dc:creator: Gregory Goodin
item.description: Hollywood, FL surf rock band Beach Day announced the release of their full-length debut, Trip Trap Attack, via Kanine Records just in time for the summer on June 18th. You might recognize them from their song in a recently circulated Victoria’s Secret commercial. The lead single from the debut is the sun-kissed “Boys”. [...]
item.content:encoded:
Hollywood, FL surf rock band Beach Day announced the release of their full-length debut, Trip Trap Attack, via Kanine Records just in time for the summer on June 18th. You might recognize them from their song in a recently circulated Victoria’s Secret commercial. The lead single from the debut is the sun-kissed “Boys”. It only clocks in at two-minutes, but its girl group harmonies drenched in sunshine is an appealing listen. Check it out for yourself below.

Tracklist:
01. Walking on the Streets
02. Boys
03. Beach Day
04. Stay
05. Seventeen
06. Trip Trap Attack
07. Little Weird
08. Come Back To Me
09. Wasting All My Time
10. Am I The Only One
11. We’ve Gotta Go

item.title: Song : Dale Earnhardt Jr. Jr. : “Hidin”
item.dc:creator: Gregory Goodin
item.description: Detroit’s finest, Dale Earnhardt Jr. Jr., are looking to follow-up their 2011 full-length, Corporate World, sometime later this year. In advance of that, they will be releasing the Patterns EP via Warner Bros. on April 16th digitially and the vinyl on Record Store Day. We already heard the upbeat and long-titled “If You [...]
item.content:encoded:
Detroit’s finest, Dale Earnhardt Jr. Jr., are looking to follow-up their 2011 full-length, Corporate World, sometime later this year. In advance of that, they will be releasing the Patterns EP via Warner Bros. on April 16th digitially and the vinyl on Record Store Day. We already heard the upbeat and long-titled “If You Didn’t See Me (Then You Weren’t On The Dancefloor)”, now we get the equally infectious “Hidin”. Listen below.

Previous:

item.title: Song : She & Him : “I Could’ve Been Your Girl”
item.dc:creator: Gregory Goodin
item.description: We are under a month away for the release date of May 7th for She & Him’s new album, Volume 3. While we were only luke warm towards the album’s first single “Never Wanted Your Love”, the second offering, “I Could’ve Been Your Girl”, has us more optimistic about this release. Regardless, M. Ward [...]
item.content:encoded: We are under a month away for the release date of May 7th for She & Him’s new album, Volume 3. While we were only luke warm towards the album’s first single “Never Wanted Your Love”, the second offering, “I Could’ve Been Your Girl”, has us more optimistic about this release. Regardless, M. Ward finally makes his presence felt and gives us what we want with a very M. Ward-sounding guitar solo on this one. Listen below.

item.title: Video : Slow Magic : “Feel Flows”
item.dc:creator: Gregory Goodin
item.description: Slow Magic revealed a short film featuring his song “Feel Flows” this past week. It was directed, produced & edited by Paris Zarcilla and is currently nominated for ‘Best Short Film’ and ‘Best Music Video’ at the London Independent Film Festival ‘13. This is wonderfully shot and epic. Watch below.
item.content:encoded: Slow Magic revealed a short film featuring his song “Feel Flows” this past week. It was directed, produced & edited by Paris Zarcilla and is currently nominated for ‘Best Short Film’ and ‘Best Music Video’ at the London Independent Film Festival ‘13. This is wonderfully shot and epic. Watch below.

item.title: Song : Valleys : “Hounds”
item.dc:creator: Gregory Goodin
item.category: Are You Going To Stand There And Talk Weird All Night?
item.description: “Hounds”, the second single from Montreal’s Valleys, sounds of hurt with Matilda Perks morose vocals and atmospheric piano chords. According to Perks, the song was written during a time when she lost several of her friends and family members in unrelated accidents. It just goes to show that through pain, beauty can occur. [...]
item.content:encoded: “Hounds”, the second single from Montreal’s Valleys, sounds of hurt with Matilda Perks morose vocals and atmospheric piano chords. According to Perks, the song was written during a time when she lost several of her friends and family members in unrelated accidents. It just goes to show that through pain, beauty can occur. The song appears on their upcoming album, Are You Going To Stand There And Talk Weird All Night?, to be released on April 30th via Kanine Records. Listen below.

item.title: [NSFW] MOKB Video Premiere: Biters: “Hallucination Generation” (Uncensored Version)
item.dc:creator: Kelly L.
item.description: The Biters have done it again. And by that I mean melted my face off (quite literally) with their audacious rock n’ roll artistry. I’m referring of course to the hot-off-the-presses uncensored video for “Hallucination Generation”, the lead track from their latest EP Last of a Dying Breed which we here at MOKB, bonafide Biters [...]
item.content:encoded:
The Biters have done it again. And by that I mean melted my face off (quite literally) with their audacious rock n’ roll artistry. I’m referring of course to the hot-off-the-presses uncensored video for “Hallucination Generation”, the lead track from their latest EP Last of a Dying Breed which we here at MOKB, bonafide Biters fans, are more than psyched to premiere.

As evidenced by their body of work, a rapid-fire series of EP’s since 2010, each loaded with electrifying, hook-filled pop, this foursome from Atlanta led by front man Tuk Smith, take the execution of their rock n’ roll ethos deadly seriously. From songwriting to recordings, the non-stop touring (recently opening for Social Distortion stateside and currently rocking Europe on their own) not to mention a rep for scorchingly-tight gigs, the Biters are possibly the most driven band on the scene today. But then there are the Biters videos: celluloid seems to be where these boys feel free to let their theatrically campy, freak flags fly. With nods to such musical touchstones as The Rocky Horror Picture Show, They Live, and Rock n’ Roll High School, the video for “Hallucination Generation” examines such vital themes as the zombie-like control of our nation through such means as organized religion, bad parenting and corporate media. On the other hand, it’s an action-packed, tongue-in-cheek, sci-fi romp about teenage rebellion against all kinds of false authority; with the Biters leading the fight against the forces of evil. In which case, it doesn’t hurt that all four band members, with their Faces’ coifs, leathers, denims and patches, look like a gang. Hell, they are a gang. An ass-kicking rock n’roll gang whose cumulative feral magnetism and penchant for bawdy hi-jinx cannot be denied.

Speaking of hi-jinx, the last three minutes of “Hallucination Generation” outtakes (scored to “Rock n’ Roll Loser”, one of my favorite tunes from their 2011 All Chewed Up EP) are absolutely priceless. Directed, edited and shot by Video Rahim and Executive Produced by Ashley Simpson, believe me when I say; this is one you’re going to watch again and again.

-Post by Miss Dolly Mod

item.title: Song : Shine 2009 : “Eurozone”
item.dc:creator: Gregory Goodin
item.description: The second album, titled Our Nation, from Helsinki pop outfit Shine 2009 will be released sometime this fall via Cascine. To hold you over until then, the duo consisting of Sami Suova & Mikko Pykäri, released the lead single “Eurozone” from the LP. The song is a smooth commentary on the current state [...]
item.content:encoded: The second album, titled Our Nation, from Helsinki pop outfit Shine 2009 will be released sometime this fall via Cascine. To hold you over until then, the duo consisting of Sami Suova & Mikko Pykäri, released the lead single “Eurozone” from the LP. The song is a smooth commentary on the current state of affairs in Europe. We have had it on repeat for the last hour. Listen below.

item.title: Video : Night Beds : “Dancing On My Own” (Robyn Cover)
item.dc:creator: Gregory Goodin
item.description: Night Beds lush country-tinged album Country Sleep is one of our favorites thus far in this early year. In the latest episode of the A.V. Clubs Undercover, singer Winston Yellon does his take on Swedish pop singer Robyn and her song “Dancing On My Own”. Yellon’s reason for selecting the song was because [...]
item.content:encoded: Night Beds lush country-tinged album Country Sleep is one of our favorites thus far in this early year. In the latest episode of the A.V. Clubs Undercover, singer Winston Yellon does his take on Swedish pop singer Robyn and her song “Dancing On My Own”. Yellon’s reason for selecting the song was because “he has it blasting in his house all of the time.” This is something that we can fully appreciate and encourage. Some of us at MOKB may or may not be known from time to time to be belting this track out ourselves in the privacy of our home or car. Watch below and see how it measures up to the original.

item.title: MOKB Video Premiere : Tape Deck Mountain : “Kellies”
item.dc:creator: Gregory Goodin
item.description: A couple of years back, we posted the song “Kellies” that was a part of a limited edition tour-only cassette from Tape Deck Mountain. Since then, the band has signed to the fantastic Lefse Records and released a new EP, Slow Salvation, this past March that includes the previously mentioned dark, shoegazey song. [...]
item.content:encoded: A couple of years back, we posted the song “Kellies” that was a part of a limited edition tour-only cassette from Tape Deck Mountain. Since then, the band has signed to the fantastic Lefse Records and released a new EP, Slow Salvation, this past March that includes the previously mentioned dark, shoegazey song. In the low budget, DIY video, the band takes that sound and puts it in front of a red, omininous backdrop with found clips that parading across the screen. It completey captures the chaotic sound of the song. The Slow Salvation EP can be purchased for download or as a flexidisc 7″ here. Watch below.
